page.title: 15Farming E: Special Interest
page.content:
The area of Borough was mentioned in the Domesday Book as Burrow. It is thought that Burrow means hill fort and the local residents presume that there was a fort situated on the top of the hill above Borough in ancient times.
The Bude Haven canal runs through Shernick farm with a couple of small ponds where the boats used to pass. There also used to be two bridges over it for cattle to use but these have now been taken down. There are a few remains of the farmhouse known as Lower Shernick which farmed the lower land and there used to be a small dam on the River Tamar to direct water along a leet to Bridgerule to drive a saw mill.
